description: Live text commentary as the Belfast Giants face the Nottingham Panthers at the SSE Arena, Belfast plus updates from Sheffield Steelers against the Cardiff Devils
title: Elite League title chase
title_page: Elite League title chase - Belfast v Nottingham plus updates from Sheffield v Cardiff - BBC Sport
maintext:
Title race goes to the final day
Sheffield win the shootout against Cardiff which takes the race to the final day of the season.
A win for the Giants secures the title.
A defeat and a win for Sheffield would see the Steelers clinch the championship.
It’s going to be a tense and thrilling finish.
Both games - Panthers v Giants and Coventry v Steelers face-off at 5.30pm and we’ll be back with all the updates you’ll need as the title race comes to a conclusion.
See you then….
Whistle keeps the Giants ahead at the end of the period
Belfast Giants 1-0 Nottingham Panthers
Jackson Whistle with a fantastic double save in the closing seconds of the period.
He pads away a shot from the point but straight to Quinn Wichers but Whistle recovers to make a stick save
The Giants sat back in the second period, they have to find a way to raise the tempo again in the final 20 minutes.
Scott Conway had to leave the ice after blocking a shot. It looks serious and he hasn’t returned which is a huge blow.
The Devils still ahead 2-1 in Sheffield.
Giants lead after first period; Still scoreless in Sheffield
Belfast Giants 1-0 Nottingham Panthers
Giants worthy of their lead at the end of the first period. They’ve almost had a second goal on a couple of occasions while offensively the Panthers have had nine shots but none have bothered Jackson Whistle all that much.
The game between Sheffield and Cardiff remains scoreless but started a few minutes after this one in Belfast
